intro: Cynoglossum neubaueri, commonly known as the Neubauer's mouse-ear, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and clusters of blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and flowers. Cynoglossum neubaueri is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
